intro: Peritassa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the genus Saintpaulia and is characterized by its vibrant, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Peritassa thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Its ability to bloom year-round in suitable conditions adds to its appeal as a decorative plant.
